title: How were provisions, stockpiles, and supplies calculated and handled in a medieval castle? Was it an art or a science? - Quora

response.answer_text: It was pretty much a down science to the most part, its not hard to calculate x amount of foodstuffs per person is needed to last a seige x long. There was an uncertainty in the amount of time you might get sieged for and how many people you would have inside so you would stockpile extra whenever possible.

You stored what you could. You had a ‘stock’ of poles to hand out as weapons, and you kept a storehouse of grain for food if you were wise. It was neither an art or a science. If an army moved quickly, it could arrive outside a castle before it had time to stock up on provisions for a siege.
